des: "This is an early (pre-Civil War) drink used by farm workers in the field. Vinegar helps to keep potassium levels up, the honey soothes the throat during a hard day of haymaking, and the ginger helps with digestion and absorbing the potassium. Also called haymaker's punch. It is very tart, probably takes a bit of getting used to."
ins:
Stir vinegar, honey, and ginger syrup together in a bowl until honey is dissolved; add water.
Chill switchel until flavors combine, 12 to 25 hours.
